body:
Thanks, Mostapha! I followed ur suggestion by replacing the original runmanager.py file with the one you provided. May I confirm with you that the only difference between them is that in your code, the "return" is comment out as shown below? [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SfsQAdhhVis9Zo5J0oOdgAYjPOalFL*ndQK*Jp6D-hdrpNqnj-4G2jsLEksbsQHfMlKFQMLhyIkcqCvzEl5f4cXBCPfD2qNo/Image1.png) After restarting Rhino and Grasshopper, I opened the outdoors_airflow demo file, and the first step of creating the case file is ok: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SfsQAdhhVitUZY3ltBmPLLKXInskf2kpAOwOVIWSPnzYzjhapb6JMhBtlh*w7aQyluEWwnA9ZKzAbeDiR6NJTQLKlZw2r2eI/Image10.png) Then the blockMesh component gives the following error: seems I have to manually start OF first..  [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SfsQAdhhVisAocLoPnSu2WhpoU0XxTdMSVKm6fyVoK13coZE7Ni*mYN3pIeNnVbpXfqhXmJUCgi7gu7-vCJ4sACZM5bG8RgL/Image11.png) so, as the error message suggested, I open OF by Start_OF.bat: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SfsQAdhhVivXDxBU9fR5-LjAo0JxWT5vOebf9W-XBadw8hlJBFXrAejRVwhMuPj68rho4EHhv0bELmXGHlu0NzDRfUZsieYz/Image4.png) Then come back to the blockMesh component, now it can be executed while the OF command line window is also openning: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SfsQAdhhViv1kcm*8tCD4dRVrYXtXGVQ7HVYEunpEcV7dbeUQ5bGadav45wHZtQDf*kSNOnosLRu9fO7GTwITAobyLaxkoIZ/Image2.png) ... and the blockMesh finished successfully: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SfsQAdhhVitidETiOmkE2nqCM2cdQiFlQbXFky5Ym8KRrNrQk1Ene-ewKxMdhCk4l-g2Kkh36FbQKuqvk9NsQDOrWQKv2Hiz/Image3.png) ... so I proceeded to run snappyHexMesh, checkMesh and update fvScheme: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SfsQAdhhViuF-mPZ0L4h6vUH7V*Ic-dvn2k9J7uaEnZpng*nZVNi0DEY0e5eoWDDJa4bkE90inBE*3zpchnENTNmpO9Ajadi/Image6.png) ... up to the simpleFoam component, I got the error again: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SfsQAdhhVivlIq5iIMu7oHf9TAo5QBRos3tpAHz4aj6Rc7-XHzVm2ghg4huXPFz2NwSP2F746UDHqb5XXl-mASTEPZLh5xdt/Image9.png)The warning message is: 1. Solution exception:
 --> OpenFOAM command Failed!#0  Foam::error::printStack(Foam::Ostream&) in "/opt/OpenFOAM/OpenFOAM-v1606+/platforms/linux64GccDPInt32Opt/lib/libOpenFOAM.so"
 #1  Foam::sigFpe::sigHandler(int) in "/opt/OpenFOAM/OpenFOAM-v1606+/platforms/linux64GccDPInt32Opt/lib/libOpenFOAM.so"
 #2  ? in "/lib64/libc.so.6"
 #3  double Foam::sumProd<double>(Foam::UList<double> const&, Foam::UList<double> const&) in "/opt/OpenFOAM/OpenFOAM-v1606+/platforms/linux64GccDPInt32Opt/lib/libOpenFOAM.so"
 #4  Foam::PCG::solve(Foam::Field<double>&, Foam::Field<double> const&, unsigned char) const in "/opt/OpenFOAM/OpenFOAM-v1606+/platforms/linux64GccDPInt32Opt/lib/libOpenFOAM.so"
 #5  Foam::GAMGSolver::solveCoarsestLevel(Foam::Field<double>&, Foam::Field<double> const&) const in "/opt/OpenFOAM/OpenFOAM-v1606+/platforms/linux64GccDPInt32Opt/lib/libOpenFOAM.so"
 #6  Foam::GAMGSolver::Vcycle(Foam::PtrList<Foam::lduMatrix::smoother> const&, Foam::Field<double>&, Foam::Field<double> const&, Foam::Field<double>&, Foam::Field<double>&, Foam::Field<double>&, Foam::Field<double>&, Foam::Field<double>&, Foam::PtrList<Foam::Field<double> >&, Foam::PtrList<Foam::Field<double> >&, unsigned char) const in "/opt/OpenFOAM/OpenFOAM-v1606+/platforms/linux64GccDPInt32Opt/lib/libOpenFOAM.so"
 #7  Foam::GAMGSolver::solve(Foam::Field<double>&, Foam::Field<double> const&, unsigned char) const in "/opt/OpenFOAM/OpenFOAM-v1606+/platforms/linux64GccDPInt32Opt/lib/libOpenFOAM.so"
 #8  Foam::fvMatrix<double>::solveSegregated(Foam::dictionary const&) in "/opt/OpenFOAM/OpenFOAM-v1606+/platforms/linux64GccDPInt32Opt/lib/libfiniteVolume.so"
 #9  Foam::fvMatrix<double>::solve(Foam::dictionary const&) in "/opt/OpenFOAM/OpenFOAM-v1606+/platforms/linux64GccDPInt32Opt/bin/simpleFoam"
 #10  Foam::fvMatrix<double>::solve() in "/opt/OpenFOAM/OpenFOAM-v1606+/platforms/linux64GccDPInt32Opt/bin/simpleFoam"
 #11  ? in "/opt/OpenFOAM/OpenFOAM-v1606+/platforms/linux64GccDPInt32Opt/bin/simpleFoam"
 #12  __libc_start_main in "/lib64/libc.so.6"
 #13  ? in "/opt/OpenFOAM/OpenFOAM-v1606+/platforms/linux64GccDPInt32Opt/bin/simpleFoam"

... and the command lines in the readMe! output are pretty long and it is saved in the text file attached here. So, my questions are: 1. why I have to manually start OF first before I can use the blockMesh component? Should butterfly automatically start OF? 2. what might be the cause of the unsuccessful run of simpleFoam in the end? Hope you can kindly advise! Thank you! - Ji
